Math Lessons
Navigation:Jordi Kling/Maths Stuff/Math Lessons/

This is the English version. [Zur deutschen Version.]

About myself

I am Jordi.

I studied mathematics at the Humboldt University. (To be more precise, I have a teaching bachelor's degree in physics and mathematics, and a master's degree in mathematics.)

I currently work as a software developer and as a substitute teacher for mathematics.

Because of my work at school and university — as a teacher or tutor, respectively — I have quite some teaching experience.

What I offer

I offer private math lessons for...

  • school — all years and all topics
  • university — all basic lectures (linear algebra, analysis, ...)

In particular (but not exclusively), I can help you with homework or exam preparation.

How much does a lesson cost?

A 60-minute lesson costs 30 euros.

Furthermore, every tenth consecutive lesson is free. (That means, ten whole lessons cost 27 euros per lesson instead.)

You can pay in cash on site or in advance via PayPal.

When and where do the lessons take place?

The lessons usually take place...

  • at my apartment in Biesdorf, or
  • online (for example, via Discord).

If neither should be an option for you, we can also meet at any other place, but then you would have to pay more (depending on the distance), and there might not be a fancy board to write on.

As for the time, I am quite flexible.

Contact

You can always reach out to me via mail (Please enable JavaScript.), or via Discord (admiralbiscuit).

You can also contact me via WhatsApp if you got my mobile number from the physical flyer.

This page was generated using a static-site generator that I built. It's crazy, isn't it?
